title: Fleetwood Mac singer-songwriter dies at 79
description: Christine McVie, Fleetwood Mac singer-songwriter and keyboardist died on Wednesday, November 30, 2022, following a brief illness, her family announced.

title: Biden pledges $135m and increased support for Native Americans
description: Speaking at a summit on tribal affairs, during National Native American Heritage Month, the US president announced several measures aimed at strengthening the community.

title: Belarusian dissident Maria Kolesnikova 'improving' in hospital, says sister
description: The oppposition leader, currently serving an 11-year sentence, was in intensive care but is to be transferred to a surgical ward and her sister says she is 'stable and improving'.

title: After a week of protests, Chinese government gives mixed signals
description: Police deployed in large numbers in Shanghai and other Chinese cities continue to detain protesters, while authorities suggest a slight relaxation of the zero-Covid policy.

title: World Cup 2022: Dramatic 1-0 victory for Tunisia over France, but Les Bleus still win group
description: Tunisia took victory after Griezmann's extra time goal was disallowed, in what was their first win against a European team at a World Cup and their third ever at the tournament.

title: After the US midterms, Washington questions its strategy in Ukraine
description: Joe Biden, who will meet Emmanuel Macron on Thursday at the White House as part of a state visit, is asking Congress for a $37.7bn new aid package for Kyiv.

title: Islamic State group announces death of its leader
description: The jihadist group said that Abu Hasan al-Hashimi al-Qurashi had been killed in fighting.

title: Channel crossings: 240 migrants rescued in 24 hours, France says
description: Local authorities in Calais said they were rescued in five different operations between Monday and Tuesday.

title: Europe and NATO grapple with what to do about China
description: NATO is meeting on Wednesday to discuss the challenges posed by China, while Charles Michel is expected to meet Xi Jinping in Beijing.

title: Who is Adnan Oktar, Turkey's 'telequranist' cult leader?
description: Oktar – aka Harun Yahya – whose creationist cult was known for its prolific publication of tracts, has been sentenced to 8,658 years in prison for charges including sexual abuse.

title: World Cup 2022: US eliminates Iran in tense atmosphere
description: The Americans beat Iran on Tuesday (1-0), taking them through to a match with the Netherlands in the Round of 16 on Saturday.

title: Investigation: The great deception of 'green' investment funds
description: Half of 'sustainable' funds invest in fossil fuels, reveal a dozen European media outlets, including 'Le Monde.'

title: French baguettes get UNESCO world heritage status
description: The UN agency on Wednesday inscribed the 'artisanal know-how and culture of baguette bread' on its 'intangible cultural heritage' list.

title: Polish residents on the border work to send aid to Ukraine as winter sets in
description: In the south-east of the country affected by the explosion of a Ukrainian air defense missile, villagers are organizing themselves to send electricity generators, basic necessities and hospital beds to their neighbors.

title: Former Chinese leader Jiang Zemin has died
description: Mr. Jiang came to power after the 1989 Tiananmen square crackdown and led his country out of isolation.

title: Ukraine pleads in Paris for the creation of a tribunal to judge Russian aggression
description: Kyiv is trying to influence the French position, which remains in favor of the International Criminal Court, to judge this particular crime: the invasion of one country by another.

title: A private-sector Japanese mission takes off for the Moon
description: On November 29, the Ispace company is sending up its Hakuto lunar lander aboard an American rocket.

title: 'The EU should abandon the idea of energy price caps and tackle the issue of equal competition'
description: The three economists Simone Tagliapietra, Georg Zachmann and Jeromin Zettelmeyer call for a quick deal on energy prices in Europe and the creation of a European energy crisis fund linked to the war in Ukraine.

title: Barcelona's ambitious mental health plan sees results
description: The Catalan city, governed since 2015 by the alternative left, has made safeguarding mental health a  priority, particularly for young people.

title: EU-27 agree to more effectively punish violations of sanctions against Russia
description: Circumventing the restrictive measures taken by the 27 EU member states against Moscow is now considered an 'EU crime.'

title: Macron visits the United States as a 'non-aligned ally'
description: During his second official visit, the French president intends to address the issue of the impact of the war in Ukraine, which is fuelling tensions between Paris and Washington.

title: 'The Korean case teaches us a lot about what 'Homo numericus' might look like'
description: A Korean study cross-references the academic performance of the digital generation with smartphone usage patterns, reports Sébastien Lechevalier in his column. The effects are mixed.

title: Climate change anxiety leads to new radicalism among activists
description: Climate activists have recently increased their actions to draw attention to the urgency of the situation, believing they're acting out of self-defense.

title: Why there is no real alternative to Twitter (yet)
description: As a platform for immediacy, news, political struggles and commentary, Twitter has acquired a unique place in the social media landscape.

title: Blank sheets of paper become a symbol of defiance in China protests
description: For protestors, the blank pages represent their demands as well as the censorship stopping them from expressing themselves. In Shanghai and elsewhere, holding a blank sheet of paper is enough to be arrested. On social media, they are immediately deleted.

title: Elon Musk's Twitter lifts rule against Covid misinformation
description: Twitter said it has stopped enforcing a policy intended to prevent the spread of Covid misinformation, as new owner Elon Musk continues to remake its content moderation policies.

title: US Senate votes to protect same-sex marriage
description: The Senate passed bipartisan legislation Tuesday to protect same-sex marriages. The bill has gained momentum since the Supreme Court’s decision to overturn the federal right to an abortion, a ruling that included a concurring opinion that suggested same-sex marriage could also come under threat.
